p: The daily rates of ED visits and hospitalizations with asthma declined by almost 45% between 2003 and 2013 [1.51 per 10 5 (95% C.I. 1.47–1.55) to 0.86 per 10 5 (0.84–0.88), 0.17 per 10 5 (0.16–0.18) to 0.09 per 10 5 (0.08–0.09), respectively, Fig 5]. There were no substantial yearly trends for the daily rates of ED visits and hospitalizations for RTIs [8.00 per 10 5 (7.72–8.29) to 7.62 per 10 5 (7.37–7.87), 0.67 per 10 5 (0.64–0.70) to 0.58 per 10 5 (0.56–0.61, respectively, Fig 5]. There was a 19% increase in the daily rates of ED visits and 16% increase in hospitalizations for COPD over 11 years [1.35 per 10 5 (1.31–1.39) to 1.60 (1.56–1.65), 0.44 per 10 5 (0.43–0.45) to 0.51 per 10 5 (0.49–0.52) respectively, Fig 5].
